titlestmt.titleproper: Finding Aid for the Kagiwada Brothers Papers, 1919-1947 LSC.2010.24
titlestmt.subtitle: Japanese American Research Project (JARP) Collection
titlestmt.author: Finding aid prepared by Manuscripts Division staff; machine-readable finding aid created by Caroline Cubé

address.addressline: Room A1713, Charles E. Young Research Library

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on 2022-09-06 10:39:10 -0700.

did.unittitle: Kagiwada Brothers papers
did.abstract: Eiho and Yoshifusa Kagiwada were brothers, born in the Kanagawa Prefecture of Japan. They emigrated to the United States where Eiho obtained a BS at Southwestern University and Yoshifusa obtained a BS from the University of Southern California. They subsequently became agents for Sun Life Assurance Company of Canada and partners in the Kagiwada Insurance Agency. This collection consists of business records and office files related to the work of the Kagiwada brothers.
did.physloc: Stored off-site. All requests to access special collections material must be made in advance using the request button located on this page.

accessrestrict.head: Restrictions on Access
accessrestrict.p: Open for research. All requests to access special collections materials must be made in advance using the request button located on this page.

userestrict.head: Restrictions on Use and Reproduction
userestrict.p: Property rights to the objects belong to UCLA Library Special Collections. All other rights, including copyright, are retained by the creators and their heirs. It is the responsibility of the researcher to determine who holds the copyright and pursue the copyright owner or his or her heir for permission to publish where The UC Regents do not hold the copyright.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: [Identification of item], Kagiwada Brothers Papers, Japanese American Research Project Collection (Collection 2010). UCLA Library Special Collections, Charles E. Young Research Library, University of California, Los Angeles.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: Collections are processed to a variety of levels depending on the work necessary to make them usable, their perceived user interest and research value, availability of staff and resources, and competing priorities. Library Special Collections provides a standard level of preservation and access for all collections and, when time and resources permit, conducts more intensive processing. These materials have been arranged and described according to national and local standards and best practices.

We are committed to providing ethical, inclusive, and anti-racist description of the materials we steward, and to remediating existing description of our materials that contains language that may be offensive or cause harm. We invite you to submit feedback about how our collections are described, and how they could be described more accurately, by filling out the form located on our website: Report Potentially Offensive Description in Library Special Collections.

bioghist.head: Biography
bioghist.p: Eiho Kagiwada was born 1895; a native of Kanagawa Prefecture, he arrived in the United States in 1914; BS, Southwestern University (1927); agent for Sun Life Assurance Co. of Canada; partner with his brother Yoshifusa in the Kagiwada Insurance Agency; he was also known as Frank E. Kagiwada.

Yoshifusa Kagiwada arrived in the United States in 1916; BS, University of Southern California (1929); was a partner with his brother Eiho and an agent for the Sun Life Assurance Co. of Canada; he was also known as Harry Y. Kagiwada.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: This collection consists of business records and office files related to the work of the Kagiwada brothers. The majority of the collection is made up of alphabetical office files of Canada Sun life insurance policyholders handled by the Kagiwada Insurance Agency (1924-41). The collection also includes income tax records and business records and correspondence.

arrangement.head: Organization and Arrangement
arrangement.p:
Arranged in the following series:
Income tax records, and business correspondence and records, 1924-47 (Box 92).
Alphabetical office files of Canada Sun life insurance policyholders handled by the Kagiwada Insurance Agency, 1924-41 (Boxes 93-102).
Miscellaneous business records, 1926-42 (Boxes 103 & 720).

relatedmaterial.head: Related Material
relatedmaterial.p: Japanese American Research Project Collection of Material about Japanese in the United States (Collection 2010) . Available at the UCLA Library Special Collections.

did.unittitle: Kagiwada Brothers Papers
Income tax records, business correspondence and records.
Copies of Kagiwada Eiho's federal income tax returns.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Also, receipts for County and school tax, County of Los Angeles, 1924-1934.

did.unittitle: Copies of Kagiwada Yoshifusa's federal income tax returns.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Also, California individual income tax return, 1947.

did.unittitle: Business correspondence of the Kagiwada Insurance Agency.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: re Canada Sun Life Insurance policies.

did.unittitle: Office records of the deceased policyholders of Canada Sun Life Insurance and their death claims.
Correspondence and office records on lapsed or cancelled Canada Sun life insurance policies.
Copies of application forms forwarded to the home office.
Lists of prospective clients.
Alphabetical office files of Canada Sun Life Insurance policyholders handled by the Kagiwada Insurance Agency.
Records on 37 policyholders, A-HA.
Records on 51 policyholders, HAR-INA.
Records on 55 policyholders, INA-KE.
Records on 42 policyholders, KI-KY.
Records on 44 policyholders, MA-MU.
Records on 49 policyholders, NA-NO.
Records on 59 policyholders, O-SA.
Records on 54 policyholders, SA-SU.
Records on 46 policyholders, SU-TSU.
Records on 53 policyholders, U-Z.
Miscellaneous Business Records
A book of cancelled checks, Kagiwada Insurance Agency.
Miscellaneous financial and business records, Kagiwada Insurance agency.
Kagiwada Yoshifusa's automobile insurance policies.
Profit and Loss Statements, Olympic Hotel.
Financial records on the Western Avenue Park Nursery.
Copies of federal income tax returns completed by the Kagiwada brothers for their clients.
Copies of applications for re-entry permits, United States Immigration and Naturalization Service, prepared by the Kagiwada brothers for clients.
Copies of the Alien Property Reports, TFR-330, United States Treasury Department, prepared by the Kagiwadas for their clients.
Records on the late Abiko Kyutaro's Memorial Fund drive, handled by the Kagiwadas.
An account book of the Kagiwada Insurance Agency.
